title: New Opening - BHARAT ELECTRONICS LIMITED
description:
A new opening has been created for the profile of Member (Research Staff) - MRS in the company Bharat Electronics Limited

Eligibility: MT - AE, EE, CSE, PSE

Should be Indian Citizen

Age Limit - 27 years for GEN, 30 Years for OBC, 32 Years for SC/ST, 10 years over & above the age limits applicable for PwBD candidates (Dt of reckoning 01.12.2025)

CPI Cutoff: 65% or equivalent CGPA for GEN/OBC(NCL)/EWS 55% or equivalent CGPA for SC/ST/PwBD

Deadline: 16th Dec 2025,11 AM

Mandatory Link - https://forms.gle/uCmm3r8BBcbb3ZS38

Please note that applications will be considered null and void if the above Google Form is not filled.

Conditions for Appointment -

Candidates who have not cleared the backlogs in subjects from the previous semesters / year are not eligible to appear for Written Test/Interview. As on the date of the Written Test/Interview, they should have passed in all subjects of previous semesters / year. Candidates from Integrated courses are not eligible for selections.  


Candidates who are presently studying in 3rd Semester of the ME/M.Tech course (2024-26 batch, 2 years course) and will pass out from the College / Institute in the academic year 2025-26 are eligible to be assessed for selections. 


BEL has introduced a Paid Internship Program for candidates recruited through Campus Placement. The paid internship program has been introduced for candidates selected through Campus selection from IIT/NITs by CRLs. The selected candidates are required to undergo internship program either at CRL-Bangalore or CRLGhaziabad for certain period which will be informed to the selected candidates in due course of time.  


The following structure is to be followed for the paid internship program:

a) For M.E/M.Tech Engineering: A stipend of Rupees 40,000 per month will be offered for a period up to 6 months.

b) The internship may be extended based on project needs/ academic requirements/ intern’s performance.  


Pre-placement Offers:

Pre-Placement offers will be issued to candidates who are provisionally selected during campus recruitment.  


Assessment Process:  

An assessment will be conducted by the Reporting/Reviewing Officer at the end of the internship period to evaluate the intern’s performance, contribution and suitability for future employment. 


Provisional Offers: 

Based on the assessment and the successful completion of the academic program, candidates will be issued provisional offers of appointment at BEL.


Service Contract / Contract Bond:  

Service Contract (Bond) to serve the company for a period of 2 years from the date of joining or pay Rs. 2 Lakhs in lieu of breach of contract (applicable also during the training period) and as stipulated in the service contract executed at the time of joining BEL.(Bond will be operative from the date of Joining)  


Leave Entitlement:  

During the Internship Period, the candidates will be eligible for the following:  

  • Weekly Saturday offs
  • Two(2) Casual-cum-Sick leave per month with a facility to carry forward the leaves to next month up to 6 months(12 leaves max). Leave can be availed with the approval of HR Head of the respective office. The unutilized leaves shall expire at the end of internship tenure.
  • Paid holidays declared by the respective Offices.

title: Interview Details - BHARAT PETROLEUM CORP. LTD.
description:
PPT for BPCL is scheduled from 8:00 AM in L6 on 11th Dec then interviews will start. All shortlisted students have to reach the venue by 7:45 AM otherwise they will not be allowed for the interview. Please make sure that you carry the below documents( Original and one photocopy for each). For Part A and Part B, 6 photocopies and Original document is required..


The shortlisted candidates will be required to submit the following documents in soft copy and carry the same in hard copy (1 copy of each document) during the Interview Process:

  • 10th Marksheet & Passing Certificate
  • 12th Marksheet & Passing Certificate
  • Semester Wise Marksheet (Consolidated into a single PDF)
  • Any 1 Valid ID proof: a) Pan card, (b) Passport, (c) Driving License, (d) Voter Identification card, (e) Aadhar Card.
  • Certificate showing proof of age (10th passing certificate / Birth certificate)
  • College ID
  • A copy of valid SC/ST caste issued by the competent authority in prescribed format, if applicable.
  • Recent & valid OBC (Non-creamy layer) certificate as per Government norms, issued by the competent authority in prescribed format, if applicable. The OBC Certificate should not issued earlier than 3 years from the date of interview.
  • One photocopy of valid Disability certificate (if applicable) - Please note that the disability certificate should have been issued by a three-member board and the type of disability should be equal to or more than 40% and permanent.
  • Placement Undertaking (Digital Signatures will not be accepted)
  • Placement Undertaking: https://docs.google.com/document/d/127hB9CG-ASbYq9VfFF9AVBaqVqUSTXCt/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=112025021568329696802&rtpof=true&sd=true
  • SC-ST-OBC-PWD Certificate Format: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1v43RlhT_UwzH3-QnqHjEKs0AoPD9jrZ-/view?usp=sharing
  • Part A (Complete with Photograph) – (Original and 6 copies)
  • PartA: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1L4ggxt_U5jq1H_W95F11ZaKUhUsn75g9/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=112025021568329696802&rtpof=true&sd=true
  • Part B – (Original and 6 copies)
  • Part B: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BnPR3-3UiR0w_wViR8rOEhDXuoqjtFjQ/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=112025021568329696802&rtpof=true&sd=true
  • Please note that students must fill their Part A and Part B forms diligently, all sections are to be filled and photographs must be attached. The caste/disability and any other detail that they mention in these forms should completely match with the data provided to us by the institute.
  1. All the documents mentioned above are to be mandatorily produced in original on the Date of Interview as a precondition for being considered for the selection process.

title: Interview Shortlist - Auro Digital Inc.
Test Instructions - Saint-Gobain Research India
description:
In order to proceed to the next round the shortlisted candidates must submit the following 3 documents in PDF format by *11 December 12:00 noon* 


1. A filled and scanned copy of the campus form. 


2.A scanned copy of the solution to the case study attached below. There are 2 case studies one for chemical engineering department students and one for material science department students. You have to only attempt the case study of your respective department. 


3. You would have to prepare for a 30 minutes(about 10 slides) presentation (Broad structure is given here).


Research Experience and showcase examples of novel research outputs


-     Problem statement

-     Methodology

-     Results

-     Key learnings

Industrial Experience

-     Key Accomplishments on commercial solutions & Business impact

Innovative aspects of problem solving and Rational thinking.


A basic introduction about you. 


After completing please submit your responses in the following google form.


https://forms.gle/2m7ADFMuqbPgnyNV6


Note: The link for an Online assessment has been emailed to all the candidates that assesment must be completed by *10th December EOD.*

  • AI/ML Software Engineer: https://auroedu.com/jobs/jobs-details/85

  • Full Stack Developer: https://auroedu.com/jobs/jobs-details/84

  • Frontend Developer: https://auroedu.com/jobs/jobs-details/83

  • Backend Developer: https://auroedu.com/jobs/jobs-details/82

  • Blockchain Developer: https://auroedu.com/jobs/jobs-details/81

Redirection to Jobs Tab

Clicking the link will redirect students to the Jobs tab and the selected role.

Mandatory Course Selection

Each job listing shows two mandatory courses (highlighted in red).

Students must select and complete any one of the two courses (Duration 120min).

Critical: How to Complete the Course on Time

  • Videos are completely OPTIONAL and not required to clear the course.

  • Due to limited time, students are strongly advised not to watch the videos.

  • To skip a video: simply click on the video and press "Back" — this enables access to the quiz directly.

  • Reaching and clearing the FINAL EXAM is critical. Students who do not reach the final exam cannot apply for the job.

Quiz & Exam Rules (Mandatory)

  • All quizzes must be completed in a single attempt.

  • All quizzes and the final exam must be passed to continue.

  • Quizzes are a mandatory eligibility requirement and cannot be skipped.

Course Access Condition

Courses must be accessed only through the Jobs tab during the application flow. Accessing them separately will make them paid; they are free only when accessed as part of the job application process.

Coupon Code to Bypass All Payments: WELCOME100

Completion & Redirection

Once all quizzes and the final exam are successfully completed, students will be automatically redirected back to the job page.

Job Application

Students must then fill in the application form, upload their resume, and answer all mandatory questions.

title: Test instructions  -  FN Mathlogic Consulting Services Private Limited
description:
The placement test is scheduled from 10:00 AM to 10:30 AM on 7th December 2025 and venue will be shared later

The self-enrollment has started, so the applicants can register themselves now, and the test will begin at 10:00 AM (The test duration will be 30 mins). Self-enrollment ends at 8 AM on 7th Dec

Note: Make sure you enter the Email ID in small letters only.

Students need to register and enroll for the test as per the procedure explained below before taking the quiz

Visit the website https://campus-hiring.fnmathlogic.com/ in incognito window.

1.  Click on Log-in written in top right corner.

2.  Click on "Create new account" button given.

3.  Enter the relevant details in the newly open page. In the email-id field, please make sure that you enter your institute email ID and NOT any other ID. Please keep the password with you, it will be required at the time of quiz.

4.  Once you enter the details and click on "Create my new account" button given at the bottom of the page, a verification mail will be sent to your registered mail id. Please click on the link given in the verification mail to activate your account.

5.  Once you are logged in, go to "Home". Scroll down and click on the "Campus Hiring" course and self-enrol

title: Test guideline | pharma ACE - PharmaACE
description:
Dear Students ,

The login window for the test is between 8:00 pm - 11;00 pm , you can start the test anytime between the login window .

Test instruction :

1. Once the test link is shared, the test will be active for certain amount of time which will be communicated to the placement POC.

2. The students will receive a link from Mettl.com and they are requested to check their inbox as well as spam folders for the test link.

3. For the test the students will need a laptop, with internet connection and webcam.

4. The students will be under webcam surveillance during the test.

5. The students need to have their ID Card/ AADHAR/ PAN Card handy, as they will be prompted to show it before the start of the test.

6. Test would consist of Numerical Ability, Logical Reasoning and Reading comprehension and Data Interpretation sections. All questions will be compulsory and there will be no negative marking.

7. The students will need to use the inbuilt calculator that is displayed on the test screen, deviation from the page will lead to warnings.

8. The students should not jump between sections too much as it might create internet issues which will lead to test ending automatically.

9. The students will not be allowed to navigate between browsers or any other application during the test.

10. The students need to ensure that their laptops or computers are plugged in and charging during the test and all the other windows/tabs are closed before starting the test. Any pop up will be treated as deviation from the test screen.

11. The link can be accessed only on Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox

12. The test cannot be taken from a mobile phone.

Test Details

Online Assessment is from 4:00 PM to 6:00 PM on 5th December and for the second round of interview from 10:00 AM onwards on 7th December. The process details are shared below:

Interview Process Overview

Round 1: Written Assessment (Duration: 120 minutes)

  • Technical Section: 30 minutes
  • Aptitude Section: 30 minutes
  • Case Study Analysis: 60 minutes

Candidates will be evaluated on their technical knowledge, problem-solving ability, and analytical skills during this round.

Time:  Friday, December 5 · 4:00 – 6:00pm

Please note that the First Round will begin with the Technical Round at 4:00 PM, followed by the Aptitude Test. The Case Study Round will then commence at 5:00 PM. During all these rounds, candidates may use a pen and paper for calculations; however, the use of a calculator is not permitted. Link will be sent through mail to all shortlisted students.

title: Test Link and Instructions - SRF LIMITED
description:
Dear Students,

Please note that entire process will be conducted online, hence, kindly ensure that the students have proper internet connectivity.

Eligibility: BT CHE

Date: 05th Dec 25

Access Time: 12:00 A.M

Test: Aptitude

Test Time: 30 min

Test Link: https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/90wl3buy9s

Date: 05th Dec 25

Access Time: 12:30 A.M

Test: Aptitude

Test Time: 30 min

Test Link:

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/90wla72whs

Please share the following instructions, with the students, to be taken into consideration before starting the test:

  1. The tests are auto timed, and all students need to start the first one (aptitude) at 12:00 p.m.  
  2. No negative marking is there. 
  3. Calculator can be used for these tests.
  4. All details are to be filled correctly before starting the test. In case the test is interrupted due to technical glitches, only by re-filling the exact details will you be able to resume.
  5. If intentionally or even inadvertently, you click on anything except the test window, the test will shut and give us an alert.
  6. The test is video-proctored; hence your camera and mic will be always switched on. Things to take care of: 

          ·  Complete face should be visible

          ·  Don't look elsewhere

          ·   There should be no other person in the room

          ·  The test detects mobile phones, so keep them away.

  1. Test related instructions will also be shown before the tests on the screen. 
  2. You can switch through questions and sections using the navigation buttons on the top. 
  3. Warning: Do not click anywhere outside the test window (Not even the task bar or minimize button. Preferable to pause antivirus programs to avoid any popup windows). After warning, test will complete automatically as it will be considered as referring for answer on the internet.
  4. If the test gets interrupted/disconnected, please wait while the window tries to reconnect automatically, and the test will resume with the old time.

description:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GOp_JrW3FCKxCggKcKnZfSmeGvBkAfviDuyrtEXEMRs/edit?usp=sharing

PFB the details of interview process

Interview Process Overview

Round 1: Initial Assessment

  • Duration: 15 minutes
  • Format: Virtual conversation
  • Outcome: Shortlisted candidates will be processed for a detailed technical assessment.

Round 2: Detailed Technical Assessment

  • Duration: 60 minutes
  • Format: Technical discussion and evaluation with subject matter expert panel.
  • Outcome: Candidates clearing this round will advance to HR assessment.

Round 3: HR Assessment – Final Round

  • Duration: 20 minutes
  • Focus: Behavioural assessment and cultural fit evaluation.
  • Outcome: Final selection and offer rollout.

title: Test Instructions - C3iHub (IHub NTIHAC Foundation), IIT Kanpur
description:
Dear Students,

Please find the test instructions in the attached document. Please go through the instructions carefully before the test. All test guidelines are available in the document linked below:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XPZEjsI0g7WAVQjmb-LdQI5EhzAcz86R2r0tn_S30l0/edit?usp=sharing

12:00 – 12:45 PM: Pre-placement talk + Briefing - L20

12:45 – 1:00 PM: Move to your allotted lecture halls (refer to the attached sheet to find your hall; only the shortlisted candidates are allotted the lecture halls)

1:00 – 1:30 PM: Buffer time (settling in + technical checks)

1:30 – 3:00 PM: Test will commence

It's mandatory to attend the Pre-Placement talk to continue with your application in the process. Attendance will be taken.

The test will have three different sets, and you will receive a personalised link for your assigned set. Do not use anyone else’s link, as it will lead to disqualification.

The test link and remaining instructions will be shared with you by 12 PM on 30th November.

Venue: L17, L18, L19, L20

title: Hall - 13 Rooms Availability - Student's Placement Office
description:
Please find below the details regarding room bookings for students coming for interviews and wishing to avail accommodation:

1. Room Availability

Boys

  • Double Rooms: 34
  • Triple Rooms: 12

Girls

  • Double Rooms: 16
  • Triple Rooms: 6

CDAP Students

  • 2 Rooms Reserved

Wing Allocation

  • A1 & A2 – Only for Girls
  • A3, A4, A5 & A6 – Only for Boys

2. Room Rates (for 3 Days)

  • Double Room: ₹600
  • Triple Room: ₹1200

3. Booking Guidelines

  • Each student can book only one room.
  • Booking will be valid for 3 days, from 30th Nov 2025, 5:00 PM to 3rd Dec 2025, 5:00 PM.
  • The Google Form link for room booking will be activated tomorrow (30th Nov 2025) between 09:30 AM and 10:00 AM.
  • Keys will be issued only to the student who has booked the room.
  • Confirmation emails will be sent at 2:00 PM on 30th Nov 2025.
  • Keys must be collected on 30th Nov 2025 between 5:00 PM and 6:00 PM. The office will close sharp at 6:00 PM.

Google Form Availability

The booking form will be available from 09:30 AM to 10:00 AM on 30th Nov 2025 for reserving A-Block rooms for the period 5:00 PM, 30th Nov 2025 to 5:00 PM, 3rd Dec 2025.

Link:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScozd4vFGoVTbIonamiEupdIbnZppU1CfdbvUQM8a3nx6ylCQ/viewform?usp=header

title: Test Link and instructions - Salescode.ai
description:
PLEASE NOTE - DO NOT CLICK ON THE "SUBMIT TEST" OPTION WHEN YOU WANT TO SUBMIT THE SECTION - BE VIGILANT TO AVOID ANY DISCREPANCIES DURING THE EVALUATION.

You will need a soft copy of your RESUME to be uploaded while you begin the test. 

Dear Candidate,

Please find the link below for the Software Engineer Trainee (FSD) Test Link online assessment.

LINK:-

https://applicatetechnology.xobin.com/wc/assessment/17C4C53B11ID

Link Validity (For starting the test) - 12:00 PM - 12:15 PM (Only the candidates starting the test between this time slot will be allowed by the software)

Timings - 12 PM onwards

Duration of the test- 60 mins

Please note this is an AI-powered test which will monitor you at all times you will be automatically disqualified if:

  1. You switch tabs when you take the test
  2. If you are found sitting without a gap or vacant seat between 2 people sitting in the lab
  3. If you are seen using unfair means or copying from some other source, the software detects your eye movements, records your screen at all times, and reports it to the admin in case there is anything suspicious.

title: Test Shortlist and details - GAIN Credit
description:
PFB test details and shortlist:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1fXnQCV2TaEx-ivwx_lkVavG7nftLyXMM1z-PU90CBNs/edit?usp=sharing

The students will be able to take the at 6:30 AM on 29th november.

Venue: Online

Please find the instructions for the test below:

  • The duration of the test will be 60 minutes. It will have 4 sections of quantitative aptitude , data interpretation, general aptitude & logical reasoning with total 35 questions.
  • Students need to have good internet connectivity , laptop with working camera & photo ID proof.
  • Students need to install the Mettl secure browser(MSB) to start the assessment, they can install the same by clicking on the assessment link.
  • MSB does not allow test-takers to move out of the application before the test is finished. It also restricts candidates from opening any unauthorized website or accessing any blacklisted software/third party applications.
  • MSB also shuts down all active applications, such as other browsers and cheating tools. It restricts access to other activities such as switching to other websites and screens during the exam.
  • MSB doesn’t have any navigation buttons, but the optional reload button in the taskbar or the key F5 can be used to reload the current page *(avoid pressing F5 key as it also submits the test if pressed while attempting the questions)
  • Screen Sharing using cable: If a candidate’s screen is shared before starting MSB: It will nor let the candidate start the test until he/she removes the screen sharing cable. If the candidate shares screen after starting MSB: the test will terminate.

 For more information about system requirements, please refer to the link below:

 

https://mettl.com/test-taker-guide/guide-for-test-taker-2/

title: Test Details - Justdial Ltd
description:
Failure to comply with any rule below will result in immediate test termination and lock.


Face Visibility: Your face must be clearly visible on the webcam at all times. Test locks immediately if face is not detected.


Screen Focus: Remain on the full-screen assessment window. Test locks immediately upon any window switch or attempt to minimize.


No Assistance: No second person is allowed in the testing area. Test locks immediately upon detection of external presence.


Proctor Warnings: Follow all proctoring messages. Test locks after three warnings.


Device Requirement: Must use a desktop or laptop computer. Mobile devices are strictly prohibited.


Webcam: A functional webcam is strictly required to start the test.


Mobile Protocol: Mobile phones must be submitted to the designated POC or secured away from the area.


Single Session: The test must be completed in one continuous session.


Marking Scheme: Questions are marked +2 for correct answers and –1 for incorrect answers.


All the best !

title: Mandatory Registration for Associate - Acceleration Center - Advisory  - PricewaterhouseCoopers (US-Adv)
description:
Registration guidelines

  • Candidates should use college email ID on the portal when applying.
  • Ensure all registration details on the portal are accurate, especially contact information such as phone number and email ID. This is important for interview scheduling and coordinating for the onboarding process if a candidate is selected.

title: Registration Link - ICICI Bank Portal - ICICI Bank
description:
PFB the application link for Data Scientist role in ICICI Bank

Eligibility: Msc Stats, Maths

Deadline to attempt the questionnaire : 25th Nov , 3PM

The Questionnaire is compulsory to attempt for successful application.

It is mandatory to apply on the below link otherwise application will not be considered

1. Online Applications: We will open online application for students on our website today . Please ensure that the students apply at the earliest. The steps to apply online are as follows:

Please visit the Campus Recruitment link - https://www.icicicareers.com/CareerApplicant/Career/job-details/2271594

Click on the link "Apply". We will recommend that applicants use personal email id for registration rather than the email id provided by the college

While selecting the degree and college, choose the correct one under the drop down. Incorrect degree and college name shall not be considered for further shortlisting.

In case if the applicant had already applied in the past on our portal, they can log in using their existing applicant ID and password. The applicants who already have an applicant ID, will have to submit the application after making necessary changes and then click on https://www.icicicareers.com/ApplicantServices/auth/login to complete the declaration tab to submit the declaration which is a mandatory step.

If the candidate is applying for the first time, they should click on Sign up and submit the application and declaration.

An Applicant ID will be allotted on successful application for first time users, applicants are requested to retain applicant ID for future and mention the same in all the correspondences with us

`

title: Deadline Extension - Standard Chartered
description:
Dear Students,

All eligible students are advised to complete the application and required assessments within the given timelines.

Deadline: Sunday, 24th November 2025, 11:59 PM IST

Job Title: 2026 Graduate Technology IIT Kanpur GBS India

Application Link: https://jobs.standardchartered.com/job-invite/44525/

Steps to Apply

  1. Create a username and password.
  2. Fill in all mandatory fields under Personal Information.
  3. Upload your updated resume.
  4. Review and submit the application.

Assessments

  • Within 1 hour of successful submission, candidates will receive the Pymetrics games assessment link via email.
  • If not received, please check the spam folder.
  • Upon clearing Pymetrics, candidates will receive the Valued Behaviour Assessment link within 1 hour.

Mandatory Responses for Disqualification Questions

Do you have the legal right to work in your chosen country without a work permit or visa? YES

Would you require a work permit or visa to join the Graduate Program permanently? NO

Link : https://indiacampus.accenture.com/register/accenture/bsclnew/apply/?event=1142317

Mandatory Registration Guidelines

  1. Email ID: Please strictly use your Personal Email ID for registration.
  2. Identity Proof:

title: Mandatory Registration and steps in application. - HSBC
description:
Dear Students ,

PFA the list of students who are eligible to register

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1V9WCM5zXhq6znxlzxdgEzwfFwBDGQXpxGhIpq9caETQ/edit?gid=0#gid=0

Only use the institute mail ID while registering.

REGISTRATION STEPS :

1.      Login to career page - Job Description - Analyst - Intern (0000LSYD)

2.      Scroll down the page, go to Recently viewed jobs and enter the text field "Keywords" the correct job number i.e. 0000LSYD and then click Search

3.      Click on "Analyst - Intern" it takes you to job page then click "Apply"( Pls note this is for the assessment purpose only)

4.      On Privacy statement click "Accept"

5.      On the next page scroll down and click on "New User"

6.      Pls ensure to mark the source as Campus Engagement/ Campus Recruitment Event

7.      Next page fill up the mandatory fields marked in * and click Register, follow the steps further and complete the registration

 The registration window will be open on 21st Nov 2025, please ensure that they complete the above steps within the stipulated timeline.

 Post that we shall trigger the HSBC Values assessment test on their registered email ID, which is a scenario-based test and they have to choose the best and worst possible answers for the scenario provided. It is imperative that they clear HSBC Values assessment before commencement of further rounds of assessment.

 Important test instructions (Mandatory for each applicant to follow):

 ·       Use latest Google Chrome or MS Edge browser only

·      Test should be taken on laptop and not mobile phone

·      Good and uninterrupted internet connectivity for seamless assessment experience

·      Register on career site using same email ID as mentioned in the application list (usage of different email ID will disqualify them from the application process)

·       Any candidate who fails to register on career site during the below stipulated timeline will stand disqualified from further process

Career Site registration timeline: by 22nd Nov 9 am

HSBC Values Assessment timeline: by 22nd Nov 11PM

title: Test Registration - Graduate Analyst - Barclays
description:
Registration Details: Students must sign-up on Barclays Recruitment Platform (Workday)

 

Registration Link:

https://search.jobs.barclays/

Registration Window:

08:00 PM to 09:00 PM (IST), 19th Nov 2025

Requisition/ Job ID:

JR-0000083521

Registration Link (if Job ID is not visible):

Registration Link

Note:

  • Registration process is mandatory (Details should be provide as per Govt. ID Card)
  • Students who successfully register will move to the next stage
  • Register on the Requisition/ Job ID using the same email ID on which you have received this email, and the same will be used for all our future communications
  • We will not be able to process your candidature further if the registration is not completed within the given timeline
  • Once logged into the candidate profile, select ‘Update Contact Information’ and ensure the fields ‘Given Name’s’ and ‘Family Name’ are both filled in. If any field is not applicable, please add an “x” to that field and do not leave any fields blank.
  • We will not be able to process the candidature if there is no registration entry against the Job ID.
  • If you are using any alternate email ID for registration, please share the same with us along with your details (Full Name, College Name, New Email ID, etc.)

title: Test Instructions - NxtWave Disruptive Technologies
description:
- Ensure your system date and time are properly synchronized.

- Update your operating system today itself to avoid unexpected restarts during the exam. Considering the time constraint, complete all pending updates beforehand.

- You will receive an application link for download before the exam (which will only work for Windows and Mac OS). Kindly check that you have sufficient disk space. To avoid issues related to low space, set the download location to the D: drive instead of the C: drive.

- Turn off all notifications before starting the exam. Any notification pop-up during the exam may lead to automatic termination of your test.

- Disable all antivirus software to prevent automatic updates or interruptions during the exam.

- Close all background applications and processes before beginning the exam to ensure a smooth experience. Failure to do so may result in unexpected exam termination without any action from your side.

title: Test Instructions - Hilti Technology Solutions India
description:
Dear Students,

Hilti Test Guidelines are as follows:

 

Test Overview

  • Duration: 60 minutes
  • Format:

Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs)

2 Video Response Questions (5 minutes each) — These are critical and must not be missed

Video Response Section

  • You will be required to record your answers using your webcam and microphone.
  • Each video question will have a time limit of 5 minutes.
  • Ensure your camera and microphone are functional before starting the test.
  • Missing or skipping the video questions may result in disqualification.

 

Test Environment Requirements

To maintain the integrity and quality of the assessment, please ensure the following:

  • A quiet and professional setup with no background noise or interruptions.
  • Stable internet connection throughout the test.
  • Webcam and microphone must be enabled and working.
  • Avoid any audio/video disturbances during the test.

 

Code of Conduct

  • This is a proctored assessment. Any attempt to use illegitimate means (e.g., external help, unauthorized software, impersonation) will be considered a serious violation.
  • Consequences may include termination of candidacy or employment.

 

Final Checklist Before You Begin

  • [ ] Webcam and microphone tested
  • [ ] Internet connection stable
  • [ ] Quiet and professional environment
  • [ ] Ready to complete all sections, especially the video questions


Regards,

Students' Placement Office

title: Login Issues - Accenture Solutions Pvt Ltd - Data AI
description:
Red Screen Issue - Resolution

Kindly uninstall the multiple camera devices and remove external camera devices.

Go to the Control Panel --> Add/Remove Programs, and remove the application with a similar name to the webcam.

In Device Manager, right-click (or press and hold) on your camera, and then select Properties. Select the Driver tab, then select Uninstall Device. Select the check box for

Attempt to remove the driver for this device, then select OK.

Kindly remove antivirus software, uninstall and reinstall Google chrome, restart the system and try again.

If the issue persists, try again in a different system.

title: Test Instructions  - Ebay
description:
Dear Student,

 

Thank you for your interest in our Software Engineering Recent Grad role at eBay India! We are very excited to learn more about you and we hope to work with you through the interview process.

 

Unlike most companies who start the application process with a resume review, we are committed to the principles of going #BeyondTheNoise and begin our application process with a fair and unbiased technical skills evaluation to help us measure your job relevant skills. The test is proctored remotely in order to ensure the validity of your results and to help us expedite your application. Prior to starting your evaluation, please click the link below to learn more about proctoring and ensure you're prepared with the required information.

 

What to bring:

  1. Bring an official photo ID with your full name like your passport, drivers license or school ID
  2. Bring your laptop to the assessment
  3. Make sure your laptop has Chrome or Firefox installed for use
  4. Use the schools strong internet connection
  5. Laptop must have viable webcam and microphone

 

General Rules:

  1. You will have 1 hour and 10 minutes to take the assessment
  2. While you are in a classroom, only you should be in view of the test. Any other person that comes into view will cause your test to be nullified.
  3. You should be connected to a power source.
  4. Use a single monitor or screen.
  5. When prompted on the day of the assessment, share your entire desktop screen as well as your webcam; do not end video or screen sharing until you have finished the test.
  6. The assessment must be completed in one session without breaks and without leaving your workstation.
  7. Close all other applications and browser tabs except for the one using the assessment.
  8. External documentation browsers are also permitted.
  9. Do not use other devices, including phones or tablets.
  10. Do not screenshot, print, or download any part of the test.
  11. Do not write or execute code in the browser's developer console or in an external editor or IDE.
  12. Web searches are allowed for syntax reference only. Other web searches will result in disqualification.
  13. Scratch paper is allowed

 

Students will receive the CodeSignal Link via RAS portal 30 minutes prior to the test. If you have any questions about the evaluation, please reach out to support@codesignal.com.

Do's:

  1. Login 5 mins before the given slot
  2. Please be on mute when you're not speaking
  3. Ensure proper connectivity
  4. Use "raise hand" option whenever you have any questions to be clarified
  5. Have a notepad & pen handy to make notes
  6. Prepare your questions before hand & share it with us on chat box

Don'ts: 

  1. Do not switch on your audio when you are not speaking
  2. Avoid talking to the people around
  3. Avoid interrupting the presenter, please wait for the presenter to complete before you ask your question
  4. Avoid repetition of questions

We believe this session will offer valuable insights into our work culture, career paths, and the innovative projects we are passionate about. We look forward to engaging with your students and answering any questions they may have. We are excited to connect with you and your students.

title: Test Shortlist and Instructions - Oliver Wyman
description:
Dear Students,

PFB the names of 74 students shortlisted based on their CVs. We will be conducting the online Mettl test for them on Monday, 10th Nov at 8PM IST. The test duration is 1 hour. 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15e_3ti5rCs0q5NsladGNknEdTUkaO5KS-S8yItSz2sU/edit?usp=sharing

Kindly ensure that the following instructions are shared with the shortlisted students in advance so they can be well prepared.

  • all students to take the test at the same time
  • the test would be proctored virtually and evaluated accordingly
  • the students must remain fully visible in front of the webcam throughout the entire session with minimal movement, any student who is only partially visible will be disqualified
  • the students should have a government ID handy for verification when attempting the test, this would be required to be shown via camera at the start of the test
  • the students should ensure they have a laptop with a functional web camera, good internet connectivity, sufficient power backup – in case of a power cut
  • as shared earlier, the test would include MCQs and coding questions to evaluate proficiency of students on Machine Learning, Statistics concepts, Coding skills on Python, Sql

title: Test Instructions - Anand Rathi Wealth Ltd
description:
Dear Students,

You have been invited to take the Anand Rathi – Aptitude MT Test scheduled for 10th November 2025. Please go through the details carefully before appearing for the test.

Test Details:

  • Date: 10th November 2025
  • Test Window: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM (IST)
  • Duration: 60 minutes
  • Platform: Online (Proctored Test)
  • Device: Personal Laptop (Google Chrome Browser Recommended)
  • Internet: Ensure stable personal connectivity

Instructions:

  1. You will be allowed to enter the test only at the scheduled time using your unique test key (mentioned below this email).
  2. In case of disconnection, you may rejoin within 5 minutes using the same test key from the same or another device.
  3. The test is AI-proctored, so ensure:
  • Proper lighting and a clear background.
  • Your face remains clearly visible throughout the test.
  • Any suspicious activity may lead to your test being paused or terminated by the proctor.

Note: You can attempt the test anytime within the given window (10:00 AM – 9:00 PM) on 10th November 2025 as per your convenience.

title: Test Shortlist and Instructions - Accordion (merilytics)
description:
Test shortlist for Accordion : https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1niHqKKoyCDDD8MEe2e0UP_CetoXqD2BLFibzdIFulKA/edit?usp=sharing

Assessment Instructions :

 * The test link is accessible only from 09:00 PM to 10:30 PM on 10th Nov'25

   * All candidates would receive a mail from admin@hirepro.in by 12:00 PM on 10th Nov'25. Please check your SPAM folder if you do not find the link in your inbox. In the email IDs attached in the tracker.

   * Please start the test by 09:00 PM. Starting the test beyond 09:10 PM will disqualify you from the test automatically.

   * Each correct answer will be awarded 1 Mark and 0.5 Mark will be DEDUCTED for each wrong answer.

   * Use updated Google Chrome as the browser for a seamless experience.

   * Calculators are allowed for use during the test. Please ensure mobile devices are not used for this.

   * Test duration :

 * Analyst 2 : 20 mins (Problem solving test)

   * Data Engineer 2 : 30 mins (Logical : 15 mins + Technical 15 mins)

   * Analyst 2 - Data Science : 50 mins (Date Science Logical : 7 mins + Coding : 23 mins + Problem solving test : 20 mins)


Things to AVOID during the test:

 * The test will be proctored by Accordion team (over zoom) and IIT Kanpur placement team (on-campus), so using any unfair means or suspected unfair means will lead to automatic DISQUALIFICATION.

   * Please DO NOT use Headsets, Earphones, Mobiles or any other devices, else it will lead to automatic DISQUALIFICATION

   * Screen toggling is not allowed and if done, the test will be disabled and the test will not be reshared.

title: Re-Test - Indus Insights & Analytics Services
description:
Date & Time: 9 November’25; 4:15 PM to 5:45 PM

Link: https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/8xjf27pzpc

Instructions for the test

  1. The test is for approximately 90 minutes and must be taken in one go; please ensure you have an uninterrupted block of time
  2. Only those students should give the test who faced issues during the previous test. Students who have submitted the test previously if found giving again will not be considered for further rounds.
  3. The test consists of 4 sections: Critical Thinking, Numerical Ability and Data Analysis, Business Problem Solving(You will be presented with a situation and relevant data points. You will be expected to solve the problem in real-time) and Guesstimate 
  4. Students will need to keep a calculator and sufficient paper and pen handy while taking the test

Test Rules

  1. It will be a webcam proctored test and the candidate's webcam needs to be turned on and working
  2. There is browsing intolerance enabled - if students try and switch their window or try to take a screenshot, we will get notified and their test will end
  3. There is no negative marking in the test
  4. Use of mobile phones is strictly prohibited and will be enforced by the platform
  5. Prior to starting, you will have the option to test your audio/video
  6. Students are requested to keep a photo identity proof handy while attempting the test
  7. A retest will not be possible for any candidate in any scenario. Please follow the above-mentioned guidelines to avoid technical disturbances 

 

Please note:

  1. There should be continuous and uninterrupted internet connection
  2. We have zero-tolerance for cheating, the placement cell will be notified in case students are caught cheating
  3. Candidates should update their browser to the latest version and clear their cache in advance of the test, to avoid technical difficulties
  4. Try to ensure that no pop-ups or notifications appear while the test is on, for example, Grammarly. The assessment platform (Mettl) would mark that as navigating away from the screen, resulting in the test ending at that moment
  5. Despite ensuring the above, in case of any technical difficulties at the time of the test, the candidate can reach out to the following Mettl Candidate Support Number: 
  6. +91 8047189190

 

Below are a few checks that can be done to ensure that students do not face technical issues:

  1. Would be good to check audio/video settings before the test
  2. Please disable extensions like Grammarly so that there are no pop-ups during the test
  3. Please do not press the Tab button during the test, as the system will take it as switching of screens, leading the test to end
  4. While the platform has proctoring mechanisms built in place, it’ll be great if you can reinforce that we have zero tolerance for cheating and that the placement cell will be notified if any such incident comes to our notice

title: Registration and Instructions - Navi
description:
PFB the list of students who haven't registered on hirepro for Navi. Deadline is 3PM today.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1eC333TemOD9TOoBXud9IczkpihgiR-pu8YUXZgOR3W4/edit?usp=sharing

System Requirements for Taking the Test:

 

·  You will need a webcam and microphone enabled laptop or desktop to take the test. DO NOT take the test on a mobile device

·  Ensure that your laptop/desktop shouldn't have any virtual camera software.

·  Use the updated version of Google Chrome (latest Version - excluding the Beta Version) for the best performance.

·  Ensure your system "Clock date" and "Time" are updated and synced with your location time zone.

·  Minimum hardware requirement of the system: RAM - 4 GB, Processor - i3 dual core 2.2 Ghz 5th Generation or equivalent/higher.

·  Ensure that the minimum speed of the internet connection is 2 Mbps (Both Upload & Download speed should be 2 MBPS or More)

·  Preferably use LAN or WiFi network connectivity.

·  Close all background applications that may trigger any system pop-ups (Outlook, other email clients, Anti-virus, Instant Messengers, News-Notifications, Other browsers/tabs, etc).

·  Ensure that the Microphone and Webcam are connected to the system & access is allowed in the browser. 

·  If blocked, follow these steps: Go to Chrome > Settings > Advanced > Privacy and Security > Content Settings > Enable Microphone and Camera

·  To verify system readiness, click on this link: https://ams.hirepro.in/assessment/#/compatibility/WEXFintech

·  Camera Check Link: https://webcamtests.com/

·  Microphone Check Link: https://www.onlinemictest.com/

title: Immediate & Final Warning: Placement Test Malpractice - Student's Placement Office
description:
Students,

This notice is regarding severe breaches of conduct in recent placement tests.

We have received official complaints and a list of names from recruiting companies confirming rampant cheating and unauthorized remote test attempts (not from the designated venue).

Action and Policy

Consequences: The Placement Office is taking immediate disciplinary action against the identified students, which includes debarment from all future placement activities and further penalties.

Zero-Tolerance: This is a final warning. All students must strictly adhere to ethical test-taking conduct and attempt all tests only from the designated venue.

Strict Penalty: Any student caught engaging in any form of malpractice moving forward will face the strictest possible action under the institute's code of conduct.

Your integrity is non-negotiable.

title: Test Instructions - SEDEMAC Mechatronics Limited
description:
Date and Time: 1 November, 8:00 PM

Note: Students should keep any physical identity proof readily available (required to show during the test registration). The Test Link will be shared at 8:00 PM

Aptitude Test (Common for All)

Test Details: Logical Reasoning, Numerical Ability, and Verbal Ability

Duration: 30 minutes

Engineer – Research & Development

Test Details: MCQs covering Fundamentals of Electronics, Engineering Mathematics, Software and Mechanical Machine Engineering, Basic Physics and Mathematics, Probability and Statistics, and Programming Principles.

Negative Marking: ¼ mark will be deducted for every incorrect response.

Duration: 45 minutes

Engineer – Electronic Hardware

Test Details:

  • Network Theory: KVL, KCL, RLC circuits, and network theorems
  • Analog Electronics: Diode, transistor, MOSFET, Op-Amp circuits
  • Digital Electronics: Logic gates, microcontrollers/processors, and related components
  • Electromagnetics: Magnetic fields, motors
  • Power Electronics and Drives: Power devices, basic circuit topologies
  • Control Systems: Transfer functions and stability

Negative Marking: ¼ mark will be deducted for every incorrect response.

Duration: 45 minutes

Engineer – Embedded Software

Test Details:

Includes both coding and multiple-choice questions.

  • Coding: Implementation of fundamental algorithms in C, focusing on basic problem-solving (without advanced data structures like trees or graphs).
  • MCQs: Based on foundational C programming concepts and basic electronics.

Duration: 60 minutes

Engineer – Manufacturing Engineering

Test Details: MCQs on Engineering Mathematics, Mechanical & Manufacturing Engineering, Electro-mechanical Systems, Basic Physics and Mathematics, Probability and Statistics.

Negative Marking: ¼ mark will be deducted for every incorrect response.

Duration: 45 minutes

title: IMPORTANT instruction - Visa Inc.
description:
Kindly take note :

Important Instructions for your Online Assessment, 31st October – 10:00PM:

  • Candidates must use the same email address they provided in the registration sheet to take the test.
  • Once a candidate logs in and starts the test or the test setup (all mandatory checks such as Video/Govt. ID proof, etc.); they cannot log out.
  • If a candidate logs out or clicks "Finish the Session," the test link will become inactive, and no new test invites or links will be provided.
  • Candidates have two options: "Take the test" or "Share previous scores." You can choose only one of the two.

If you chose to share previous score, please remember:

  1. You need to change your Coding Report privacy settings to Everyone in your profile for this to work. (For help, read How do I update my Coding Report Privacy Settings?) Then you need to click the green SHARE EXISTING button.
  2. If your previous results that you want to share were not proctored, you will not be able to share your previous results. You will have to take the Visa Assessment
  3. If you choose to proceed with a Take the assessment and earn a lower score from your previous result, Visa will only receive your new result, regardless of whether the score is higher or lower than the previous attempt.
  4. If you want to undertake any practice tests prior to the actual assessment, please do so by clicking on the Green Practice icon.

 

Please note that solution correctness is only one dimension within our evaluation of performance for this assessment and does not guarantee" advancement to the next stages, the assessment

 

Note: Students should have good lighting in the room and a physical ID card (government ID proof) with them to appear for the test.

All students are required to take the test from LHC

Any student found taking the test from any other location will be subject to strict disciplinary action.

title: Mandatory Registration :Microsoft Software Engineer (SWE) - Microsoft India
description:
Microsoft Software Engineer Opportunity for 2026 Graduates

Attention Students,

For those interested in applying for the Microsoft Software Engineering (SWE) role, please see the application details below.

It is mandatory for all students who wish to participate in the Online Assessment to complete their application on the Microsoft careers portal before the deadline.

Application Deadline: 1 Nov EOD

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Degree & Branches: Open to all BT/BS/DoubleMajor/Dual and M.Tech CSE
  • CGPA: 7.0 and above
  • Backlogs: No current backlogs
  • Year of Graduation: 2026 only

Application Process:

1. Role & Job ID:

  • Role: Software Engineer
  • Job ID: 1900192

2. How to Apply:

  1. Click on Microsoft Career Page or directly Click Here to apply.
  2. You will be asked to sign in using 4 options. Please sign in with your personal email address.
  3. Fill in the application form completely and correctly.
  4. Fields like contact information/experience/education/additional information are required to be filled in the form.  
  5. Please answer all the questions correctly. 
  6. Ensure your resume is attached. In case you miss attaching your resume, the hiring team will not be able to view your complete profile and may lead to disqualification.
  7. Carefully complete your application process and hit the submit button.

Important Instructions:

  • Please make sure you apply to the correct Job ID as per the role.  
  • Fill in your complete college name and do not use abbreviations.   
  • Please ensure you complete the entire application. Incomplete applications will be disqualified. 

Candidates with Disabilities:

  • At Microsoft fostering a hiring process that is inclusive of candidates with disabilities is a top priority, which is why we've made it easier to request accommodations that allow candidates to fully participate and show their capabilities during the interview.

title: Test Instructions - Gan artificial intelligence private limited (Chariot)
description:
Please find instructions below:

Test will start at 2:15PM in L7

1) Common Placement Test (30 minutes)

2) SWE Placement Test (45 minutes)

3) RE Placement Test (60 minutes)

Format:

1) We should distribute the common test first, and take it back in 30 minutes.

2) Only SWE students should return the SWE Section after 45 minutes.

3) Only RE students should return the RE Section after 60 minutes.

4) Students attempting both should return SWE + RE sections after 60 + 30 = 90 minutes.

Max Time of Test = 30 (common) + 90 (both SWE+RE) minutes = 120 minutes


No Phones/Computers allowed while taking the test. It is a pen and paper written test.

title: Important Guidelines for Accenture Registration - Accenture
description:
Dear Candidates,

Please take note of the following important instructions regarding document upload and OTP issues during registration:

Document Upload (PAN / College ID):

  • If you are unable to upload your PAN Card or College ID, please ensure that the document is in JPG or PNG format only.
  • Other file formats (PDF, DOC, etc.) will not be accepted.

Invalid PAN Upload:

  • Please upload a clear picture of your PAN Card.
  • The image should not be blurry or pixelated, and the entire PAN Card must be visible in the photo.

OTP Issues:

  • If you are not receiving the OTP, please check your email storage (inbox capacity and spam folder).
  • After checking, kindly resend the OTP and try again.

title: Test Instructions and Link - Indus Insights & Analytics Services
description:
PFB the online test link:

https://tests.mettl.com/authenticateKey/8u8ehlysxs

Instructions:

 Online Test

  1. Instructions for the testDate & Time:  18th October, Saturday, 1 to 2:30 PM
  2. Students can attempt the test from their respective rooms.
  3. The test is for approximately 90 minutes and must be taken in one go; please ensure you have an uninterrupted block of time
  4. The test consists of 4 sections:
  5. Critical Thinking
  6. Numerical Ability and Data Analysis
  7. Business Problem Solving
  8. You will be presented with a situation and relevant data points. You will be expected to solve the problem in real-time
  9. Guesstimate 
  10. Students will need to keep a calculator and sufficient paper and pen handy while taking the test

 

  1. Test RulesIt will be a webcam proctored test and the candidate's webcam needs to be turned on and working
  2. There is browsing intolerance enabled - if students try and switch their window or try to take a screenshot, we will get notified and their test will end
  3. There is no negative marking in the test
  4. Use of mobile phones is strictly prohibited and will be enforced by the platform
  5. Prior to starting, you will have the option to test your audio/video
  6. Students are requested to keep a photo identity proof handy while attempting the test
  7. A retest will not be possible for any candidate in any scenario. Please follow the above-mentioned guidelines to avoid technical disturbances 

 

  1. Please note:
  2. There should be continuous and uninterrupted internet connection
  3. Please note that students who are applying to us necessarily need to attempt the online test. Ensure that they login via their official (college) email ID. No other email IDs will be permitted
  4. We have zero-tolerance for cheating, the placement cell will be notified in case students are caught cheating
  5. Candidates should update their browser to the latest version and clear their cache in advance of the test, to avoid technical difficulties
  6. Try to ensure that no pop-ups or notifications appear while the test is on, for example, Grammarly. The assessment platform (Mettl) would mark that as navigating away from the screen, resulting in the test ending at that moment

 

Below are a few checks that can be done to ensure that students do not face technical issues:

 

  1. Would be good to check audio/video settings before the test
  2. Please disable extensions like Grammarly so that there are no pop-ups during the test
  3. Please do not press the Tab button during the test, as the system will take it as switching of screens, leading the test to end
  4. While the platform has proctoring mechanisms built in place, it’ll be great if you can reinforce that we have zero tolerance for cheating and that the placement cell will be notified if any such incident comes to our notice

We had a great time at your institute during our Product Management Workshop! Your engagement and passion were truly impressive, and we trust you now have enough reasons and understanding to give your best shot for the APM role. We're eager to proceed with you for further rounds of selection.


The Next Step: Your Pitch Deck 

The moment has arrived for the Problem Statement and Deck Submissions. Please review the critical details for this round below:

1. There are 2 Problem Statements attached below - you would be expected to attempt any one of them

https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/11Er23jPGSJvjPTyaOKOO1e-XvOR-DmwO/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=106452775992175567132&rtpof=true&sd=true

https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1DpIDRdqbuClyKh7lpkuIfhDMp0_DQf1r/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=106452775992175567132&rtpof=true&sd=true

2. The submission format is a pdf, the template for which is also attached along with the problem statement

3. Submission has to be made via this FORM, before 11:59 pm, 20 Oct'25. [Not subject to any extension]

4. For any queries, kindly share them Here, and we would get back to you in 24 hours. 

5. For more information, feel free to visit our APM Website. 


All the best!

title: Test Link | Test shortlist | Test venue | Squarepoint Capital  - Squarepoint Capital
description:
Dear students,

PLB the test shortlist of Squarepoint Capital for all three roles.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1RDaCfBSiPXvbR491ZpjqbcZ0EFsGRuqh71urnJeAQAw/edit?usp=sharing

All shortlisted candidates should have received the test links. If you haven’t found it in your inbox, kindly check your SPAM/junk folder and ensure you search your email carefully.

Test Venue : L18 , L19 and L20

Test Instruction :

1) The test will begin at 9:00 AM on 3rd October.

2) All test links will remain open in sequence, with a 15-minute break between each test.

3) The order of roles in which candidates must attempt the tests will be communicated at 8:00 AM on the same day.

4) Every candidate must mark their attendance for the roles they have applied for. Three separate attendance sheets will be available (one for each role) – please ensure your name is marked correctly.

5) For DQA and Infra roles, each student will receive one test link per role.

6) For the Software Development role, students will receive two test links (Python and C++). You may attempt only one test as per your expertise.

7) Candidates are not permitted to leave the hall early, even if they finish before the allotted time.

8) Mobile phones, headphones, bags, and books are strictly prohibited inside.

9) Any student found taking photos or screenshots of the test/questions will be disqualified immediately.

title: Mandatory Application Forms for Square Point Roles - Squarepoint Capital
description:
All students who are eligible for the Square Point roles must fill out the corresponding Google Forms. There are three separate forms, each for a different role. To successfully apply for a specific role, you must complete its dedicated Google Form.

Applying on the portal and filling out the Google Form is mandatory for a successful application.

  1. Desk Quant Analyst : CPI Criteria Cutoff: 7.5+

This Role is Open to BT/BS/Double Major / Dual CSE, EE, ME, MTH, SDS, PHY

G form link : https://forms.gle/SxNs6vWgmN2QZnDF6

2 . Infrastructure Engineer: CPI Cutoff Criteria:

CS/Math : 7+

Others: 8+

This Role is Open to BT/BS/Double Major / Dual CSE, EE, ME, MTH, SDS, PHY

G form link : https://forms.gle/MLzYXL3fjuR9Yybh9

3 . Graduate Software Developer : CPI Cutoff Criteria:

CS/Math : 7+

Others: 8+

This Role is Open to BT/BS/Double Major / Dual CSE, EE, ME, MTH, SDS, PHY

G form link : https://forms.gle/HMgUfnJtKkDNhfy8A

Please note: If you do not meet the eligibility criteria for these roles and still fill out the forms, strict action will be taken.

title: Regarding Events scheduled in Midsem Break - Student's Placement Office
description:
Dear students,

Please note that it is mandatory to stay back in the mid-semester break as Placement Events - PPTs and Tests are scheduled in the break. It is compulsory for students to attend the PPTs and give the tests from lecture halls. The following are the company whose processes are schedules. Please note that there might be a few additions to the list and will be informed in due time.

Square Point

Ebullient Securities

Wex Fintech Pvt Ltd

Paytm ( SDE )

Please keep in mind the following rule while applying to companies

The maximum number of applications for any student on the placement portal before November 10, 2025, is 50. In case the count increases beyond 50, the student will not be able to apply to any other company.

title: Pre-Placement Talk by Swiggy - Student's Placement Office
description:
We are pleased to announce that Swiggy will be conducting its Pre-Placement Talk (PPT) for the upcoming placement season.

The session will be taken by Mr. Anurag P., Vice President – Revenue and Growth at Swiggy, and an esteemed alumnus of IIT Kanpur. This is a great opportunity to gain first-hand insights into Swiggy’s journey, work culture, and the exciting roles they are bringing to campus.

Date: 4th September

Time: 8:30 PM

Venue: L-19

Important Note: Participation in the PPT will play a crucial role in determining the hiring numbers and the variety of roles Swiggy brings to campus.

We encourage all interested students to attend and make the most of this session.
